title: Mansfield Park - narrator implies Mr. Rushworth

content.question: In the first sentence of the passage, the narrator implies which of the following about Mr. Rushworth?

choices.label: If he had already been married when he met Miss Bertram, he would not have thought that she was beautiful.
If he had not been disposed to get married, he might not have thought himself in love with Miss Bertram.
If he had known much about Miss Bertram other than her physical beauty, he would not have thought he was in love with her.
If he had truly loved Miss Bertram, he would have wanted to marry her even if she were not beautiful.

content.answer: If he had not been disposed to get married, he might not have thought himself in love with Miss Bertram.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe what specific textual details reveal about a character, that character's perspective, and that character's motives.
